DOC.brief_summary: In 4-arm , randomize control trial , evaluate relative effectiveness cost-effectiveness improve cholesterol level among participant high risk CVD elevate LDL cholesterol level test process versus outcomes financial incentive . Participants use electronic pill bottle continuously monitor statin adherence . The primary outcome change LDL cholesterol 12 month .
DOC.brief_title: Process Versus Outcomes Incentives Lipid Management
DOC.criteria: Individuals high risk cardiac event , specifically one following : Individuals clinical ASCVD ( define diagnosis myocardial infarction , stroke , peripheral vascular disease ) LDL great equal 100 mg/dl ; Individuals Diabetes ( age 4075 ) LDL great equal 100 mg/dl ; Individuals without clinical ASCVD diabetes LDLC LDL great equal 100 mg/dl estimate 10year ASCVD risk 7.5 % ; Individuals without clinical ASCVD diabetes LDL cholesterol 190 mg/dl A prescription fill statin medication within last 12 month ( derive pharmacy record ) ; Medication Possession Ratio ( MPR ) less equal 80 % A score 0 8item Morisky Medication Adherence Questionnaire complete enrollment Under 18 year old A contraindication statin use suffer statin side effect , myopathy Will give consent A history active progressive liver disease abnormal liver function test baseline screen [ Alanine aminotransferase ( ALT ) aspartate aminotransferase ( AST ) great 3x upper limit normal ] . Participating another clinical trial relate aim Comorbidities likely lead death within short period ( e.g . metastatic cancer )
